intro: Terebinthina, commonly known as the terebinth tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to parts of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Europe. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark and resin have been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes. Terebinthina typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and can reach heights of up to 10 meters.
